result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement(s) signed by Judge Paul F Reilly August 29, 2022.

10:58 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason D Lepak in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Jason D Lepak.   Court inquires how the matter is proceeding today.  Atty. Gutierrez just needs his client to sign the document and is ready to proceed with plea and sentencing today.  Court recites the offer as listed on the plea questionnaire.  State confirms the offer and outlines the conditions of probation they are seeking.  Defense confirms the offer.  Pursuant to the offer the Court orders this case dismissed and read into 22CF866.
Proposed Motion and Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement(s) submitted by the State.
Filed by Victim B.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

08:48 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Jason D Lepak in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he is requesting a projected plea and sentencing in about 30-45 days.  Court adjourns for projected plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:20 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Jason D Lepak in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires how the matter will be proceeding.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he has an offer and parties are inclined to resolve but he is still waiting for discovery.  Atty. Gutierrez requests a further proceedings in about 30-45 days, but if matter can be converted to plea and sentencing he will advise the court immediately.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Hearing on May 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Witness A/Piggly Wiggly listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.

01:36 PM Defendant Jason D Lepak in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
